intro: Pavetta shimbensis, commonly known as Shimbé pavetta, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
